titles.title: Mäwaśǝʾt, Antiphonary for feasts and funeral service / Zǝmmare, Eucharistic hymns

shortcontents.shortcontent: I) Mäwaśǝʾt, Antiphonary for feasts and funeral service (fols. 2r-32r) II) Zǝmmare, Eucharistic hymns (fols. 33r-64v).

txstates.txstate: Fol. 0 is mutilated. Holes are carefully amended on fols. 12, 37. The attachment of the front board has been repaired with recent white threads.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible in the centre fold of the quires, close to the head and tail of the codex. Spine protection made of parchment.

inks.ink: Black, red (strong scarlet on fols. 2r-32r; red on fols. 33r-48v; strong red in fols. 49r-64v)

txfolios.txfolio: Pic. 0 depicts fol. 0; pic. 1a depicts a pic. following 1.

squires.squire:
A(1; s.l.: 1/fol. 1) – I(8/fols. 2r-9v) – II(8/fols. 10r-17v) – III(8; s.l.: 6, stub after 2; 3, stub after 5/fols. 18r-25v) – IV(7; s.l.: 1, stub after 7/fols. 26r-32v) – V(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 6; 6, stub after 3/fols. 33r-40v) – VI(8/fols. 41r-48v) – VII(8/fols. 49r-56v) – VIII(8/fols. 57r-64v).
Pieces of parchment which are visible between fols. 1v and 2r, and between fol. 64v and the back board are part of the spinelining.

taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are partly visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

phandwritings.phandwriting: Hand a: mediocre but careful; hand b: mediocre

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Hand a: fols: 2r-32r. Hand b: fols. 33r-64v, somewhat less careful than hand a; in some portions of the Ms., the handrwiring is uneven. Text I is written with smaller letters in comparison to those of Text II. The letters of Text I gradually become smaller and their size stabilizes around fol. 10.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; names of the categories of melody and their abbreviations (ʿǝzl, gǝʿǝz, ʾararay); elements of the punctuation signs; Ethiopic numerals and/or their elements. Text 1 A few lines on the incipit page; names of antiphons (mäwaśǝʾt) followed by feast names and initial text lines; the number of the psalm and its initial words; names of sections of antiphons and their abbreviations (mǝlṭan and mäzmur). Text II A few lines on the incipit page; names of sections (zǝmmare) preceded or followed by feast or day names and, sometimes, initial text lines; names of subsections and their abbreviations (e.g., mänfäs, ṣǝwwaʿ) occasionally followed by feast names; musical notation signs: interlinear (e.g., fols. 39vc, 41rabc, 42vab, 46vb, 52vb, 53vc, 54ra, 54vab, 55rab, 56rc, 56va) and elements of marginal. The rubrication in red is executed very carelessly with big letters not fitting into the blank spaces left for them (s. e.g., fol. 33r), most probably in a secondary hand.

abbreviations.abbreviation: ም፡/ምል፡/ምልጣ፡ for ምልጣን፡ መ፡/መን፡/መንፈ፡ for መንፈስ፡ መዝ። for መዝሙር፡ መዋሥ፡ for መዋሥዕት፡ ጸሎ፡ for ጸሎተ፡ ጽዋ፡ for ጽዋዕ፡ ይባ፡/ይባር፡ for ይባርክዎ፡ ዕዝ፡ for ዕዝል፡

extras.extra: - Title of the Ms., ዝ: መዋ (i.e., ዝማሬ , መዋሥዕት), is written on the front board. - Title of the Ms., ዝማሬ, is written in pen: fol. 1r. - Tämälläs-signs indicating the place where the omissions, written in the margins, belong: In the shape of a cross, in the main hand: fols. 2vc l.15, 3rb l.4, 5va l.11, 18vc l.14, 27rb l.21, 45vc l.13, 52rc l.3. In the shape of two perpendicular lines, in the main hand: fols. 38rb l.19, 39rb l.6. In the shape of a cross, in a secondary hand: fols. 52ra l.4, 56rb l.9, 60ra l.23, 64ra l.23, 64vb l.7. - Passages omitted in the main text are written in the upper margin, in the main hand: fols. 6v, 10v, 16r, 17r, 22rc, 26r, 26v, 28vc, 29vab, 33vb, 34va, 57ra, 58ra. - Passages omitted in the main text are written in the upper margin, in a very crude secondary hand: fols. 51vc, 52rc, 59rab, 59va, 62va, 63vc. - Correction is superimposed on a part of the subsection title: fol. 61vc ls. 1-2. - Minor note in Amharic: fol. 1v. - Note in pencil: fol. 19r.

frames.frame: Fol. 2r: finely elaborate coloured (dark blue, red, yellow) ornamental band with four vertical extensions reaching the bottom of the text; geometric, floral and anthropomorphic motifs. A pair of ailes over each image of "face". Fol. 9v: elaborate coloured (dark blue, red, yellow) ornamental band with four extensions reaching the bottom of the text; interlaces, geometric, floral motifs; floral, anthropomorfic and zoomorfic motifs used for the decoration of the horizontal band. Fol. 49r: elaborate uncoloured ornamental band with four vertical extensions reaching the bottom of the page; interlaces, anthropomorfic motifs. Fol. 2vb: coloured (dark blue and yellow) ornamental band; interlaces. Fol. 3vb: uncoloured ornamental band; interlaces. Fol. 8vb: coloured (yellow, dark blue) ornamental band; interlaces. Fol. 33ra: black ornamental band; interlaces.
